title: The game is not dying it's just degrading, here's why
body:
You know Riot Games doesn't care about their game only about the money
-Ryze had a low win rate and yet they nerfed him hard, what is the mentality in that?! They just want all champs in the game to be reduced to nothing as they find any champ that displays any strengths they will remove it, no differences in power is what is going on now for all champs where even tiny champs can beat mighty giants.
Azir was "balanced" his ult is just unique but a high cooldown none the less.
 
This does not sound professional!
(Master Yi) should not lose 1v1 to (jinx) in close up match up!?
they fucked his devourer and guinsoos rageblade so now what is he, just a melee champ?? come on riot you can do way better :)

replies.body:
Riot does not balance for bronze V, sorry.  Trying to balance for bad players just wrecks the competitive game, and guess what? low elo will still suck, because what is "good" is meaningless at that level.
Balancing is a lot harder than just buffing and nerfing stuff, it all has side effects on the metagame and other champions - look at what happened to ahri.

Come back with convincing arguments.

Yi performs pretty solid at low elo and he even sees play at the challenger level (Froggen plays like one or two games with a Yi every time I catch him streaming).

Ryze DOMINATES when someone knows how to play him, and they didn't want that dominance to be so easy to obtain, hence the nerfs.

Azir is a Ryze case as well.

Riot not wanting "strong" champions would mean you'd see people like Ivern, Kha'zix, Graves, Lee, Syndra, Orianna, and Rumble nerfed into the ground due to their outstanding use in LCS. This argument is just overall weak and nonsensical.

>-Ryze had a low win rate and yet they nerfed him hard, what is the mentality in that?!

>(Master Yi) should not lose 1v1 to (jinx) in close up match up!?

Sigh
